The Public is respectfully informed, that the ORATORIOS will commence

T H I S E V E N I N G , F R I D A Y , F E B R U A R Y 26, 1830,
At the above Theatre, and will be continued on the Wednesdays and Fridays during Lent, alternately at Covent Garden
and Drury Lane Theatres, under the Management and Direction of Mr. H A W E S ;
WHEN WILL BE PERFORMED A

G R A N D SELECTION.
PART I.

SCENE FROM HAYDN'S SEASONS.
INTRODUCTION.
Kecit. Mr. P H I L L I P S , " A t last the bounteous sun."
Recit. Mr. P H I L L I P S , " Behold where surly winter."
Air, " With joy th' impatient husbandman."
Recit. Mr. B E N N E T T , " Behold from craggy rocks."
Recit. Mr. B E N N E T T , " Laborious man."
Recit Mrs. ATKINSON, " Forth fly the tepid airs."
Grand Chorus, " God of light."
Sem.:-Chorus, " Come, gentle Spring."
Recit. Miss BRUCE, " Ye sacred priests ;" and Air, " Farewell, ve limpid springs."

Hia Maje*ty% Servant! will act a new Drama, in Three Act*, called

PAST & PRESENT;
Or, The Hidden

Treasure.

fJ3" The unusual construction of this Drama renders it necessary to state, that t h e action of the Piece relates to
th ree period?, distinct and distant from each other ; the first act being supposed to pass a day or two prior to the
tlestructiou of the Hastilie; the second, at some peiiod of the Reign of Terror ; and the third, about the present time

On his first Appearance, having been greeted b j a crowded Audience, with general and enthusiastic approbation.
will appear again on Saturday and 1 nesday nest.

Oh its first Representation, was most decidedly successful, and will be repeated oa Saturday^ Monday, and

GRAND PERFORMANCE
OF

S A C R E D MUSIC.
The Public are respectfully informed, that, in consequence of the loss sustained (from various circumstances
by the Director of the Oratorios, the Committee of the above Theatre have kindly accorded an extra Night,

On Wednesday

next^ Jlpril 7, 18SO

On which occasion the Performers, almost without exception, have also tendered their
gratuitous Services.

T H E PERFORMANCES W I L L CONSIST OF

ACT OF

USIC.
The Public is respectfully informed, that, in consequence of the great Loss sustained by the Director of the Oratorios during the
Lent Season, the Committee have, in the most handsome manner, gratuitously granted the use of the above Theatre, for

This Evening, Wednesday, April 7th- 1830,
When will be performed, under the management and direction of Mr. HAWES, the following Selection of Sacred Music.

PAR'!' I.
